DESCRIPTION: Spawns less often than other #yRelics of its type.
Target takes #b10% more damage for each stack additively, resets to #b0 each turn and increases by #b1 when a card is played.

#yPassive: At the end of your turn deal damage to a random enemy (Base: #b1 [REMOVE_SPACE]). NL #yOrb damage affected by #yStrength [REMOVE_SPACE], #yDexterity and #yFocus [REMOVE_SPACE]. NL #yEvoke: Gain #b1 #yOrb slot and #yChannel this #yOrb [REMOVE_SPACE].
At the start of this creatures turn, #yOn #yFire is increased by #b1 then it will lose HP. Damage is doubled if the target is #yVulnerable [REMOVE_SPACE].
When you draw a #yStatus or #pCurse card, deals damage to ALL enemies.
Potion: Deal #b25 damage to the target and apply #b5 #yOn #yFire.
While you have the relic #yMageblood [REMOVE_SPACE], apply #b4 #yOn #yFire to ALL enemies before the start of combat for each potion slot.
While you have the relic #yMageblood [REMOVE_SPACE], another potion will be added to all combat rewards.
Whenever you play a card, gain Block.
A relic inspired by MTS bot creator and fox appreciator Nelly. Feel free to provide foxes in #modding-technical.
A relic inspired by Modding veteran Vex. Suitable Vex art included.

Monday: Gain [E] [REMOVE_SPACE][E] next turn. NL Tuesday: Draw #b2 cards next turn. NL Wednesday: #yExhume a card and #yUpgrade it. NL Thursday: Draw #b3 cards and discard #b3 cards. NL Friday: Gain #b1 #yRitual [REMOVE_SPACE]. NL Saturday: Gain #b8 block. NL Sunday: Apply #b1 #yWeak [REMOVE_SPACE], #yVulnerable and #yConstricted to ALL enemies.

Odd morning: Duplicate #b2 random cards. NL Even morning: Transform #pAscenders #pBane into two #pNecronomicurse or gain two #pAscender's #pBane [REMOVE_SPACE]. NL Odd afternoon: Lose #r20% of your maximum health. NL Even afternoon: Randomly #rremove #b2 cards. NL 3am: Add #pCurse #pOf #pThe #pBell to your deck, except on the 13th day of the month and if its a friday instead obtain a special relic.
When you draw cards whilst heavily confused, their cost is shuffled and may be increased up to a maximum of 3 but will never be lower than the base cost.
